text: Is there a way to access a variable inside a custom module from an other module? I have 1 grid/list view switcher and 1 blog overview module. Inside this grid/list view switcher I do set a variable (“list”, “grid”) which I want to use inside the overview module.

Morning folks, where do I find association definition ID for a custom object?

Besides the pre-sets <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-associations/crm-associations-overview>, I can't seem to find the documentation telling me where to grab ones for a custom obj

hey! I sussed it! you were correct, I was pulling a variable for the table ID that was blank, so got it working now i think! Much appreciate the help.
The 'choice' field, how can i change the name of it within the page? i tried label but that doesn't seem to work, see photo :slightly_smiling_face:
Nevermind - it wouldnt update on the page, used the template again and it changed.

Have any one of you happened to solve the orphaned blog post issue on paginated pages?  I'm using <@U26AKMZ19> method available in the boilerplate theme in order to have a FEATURED POST on the Blog Listing Page.  This requires I set the number of posts to show in my content settings to 10.

1 Featured Blog Post at the top.
3 rows of 3 column blog posts below

But when clicking to the 2nd, 3rd, etc. paginated page, this orphan blog post hangs at the bottom.

Have you solved this? Love to know what you've done.

Here is my basic code logic:


`{% for content in contents %}`

`{% if (loop.first && current_page_num == 1 && !topic && module.start.show_feature_card) %}` 

`SHOW LARGE FEATURED CARD`

`{% else %}`

`SHOW SMALL NORMAL CARD`

`{% endif %}`

`{% endfor %}`
Sounds like you have a bug in your HubL code. Can you post your code so folks can review it?
Good call <@U7SL518D6>. Just added the conditional logic to the original post.

> I’m using <@U26AKMZ19> method available in the boilerplate theme in order to have a FEATURED POST on the Blog Listing Page.
That code isn’t in the boilerplate. Where did you find it?

I added two extra conditionals but I'll find the link to where I got it in a moment.

May have been an early boilerplate version.
What is the output value of `module.start.show_featured_card`
<@U7SL518D6> it's a boolean field that's set to true by default.
<@U7SL518D6> here is basically where I pulled the original conditional logic from. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/blog>
can you DM me a link to the page where you’re experiencing the orphan? I can’t seem to reproduce the issue on my end.

Just realized - is the problem you’re experiencing only happening on page 2+ because the code changes from displaying a featured item to just listing on page 2+. Thus if your CSS isn’t designed to accomodate for 10 items you’d see what you’re seeing.

You would be able to remove the `current_page_num == 1` part if you always wanted a featured item to be displayed, just be aware. it would then grab the first item on every page.

You could change this to always be the latest post by instead doing a blog_recent_posts call and grabbing just the first item. Render the featured card. Then on the first page just don’t render the first item in your main loop.
<@U7SL518D6> Yes, this is exactly the thing going on. I do realize that I can remove that piece of logic so that each paginated page (2+) has the large featured card.  I'm just trying to avoid it.

<@U7SL518D6> That is a pretty clever workaround. Just seems a bit complicated for something that should be simple. I was reading this post in the community forum and would love something like what the author suggested.

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Control-Number-of-items-in-content-loop-by-page-number/m-p/571123>


```{% for content in contents %}
{% if current_page_num == 1 %}
{% set loop.length == 5 %}
{% else %}
{% set loop.length == 6 %}
{% endif %}
{% endfor %}```

your options are:
• update your CSS so you can handle displaying 10 items cleanly on other pagination.
• Use the `recent_blog_posts()` technique then your featured item will be consistent across all of the pages. Simply change the logic of that if condition to just not show anything if `current_page_num ==1`. 
• remove `current_page_num == 1` from the logic. Then the first item per page will be featured.
Each of these 3 solutions is fairly simple.

The community forum post there proposes overriding the number of posts that are in the array, which isn’t how things work.
`loop.length` returns the number of items in the array you’re looping through. You can’t modify it nor would you want to as then it would be out of sync with the list you’re iterating through.

You could remove the featured item from the array you’re looping through prior to looping if you wanted though.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/for-loops#loop-properties>
<@U7SL518D6> Thanks so much for helping and your guidance. Super appreciated.  Thanks for spelling out the options available.
